alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Columbia, northern Suwannee and central Hamilton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Suwannee Springs to Suwannee River State Park. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Jasper, White Springs, Suwannee Springs, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Valley, Dowling Park, Blue Springs, Crossroads and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
